quoteFirst: He expatiated on the national advantages that would accrue from a reduction of interest. From easy and obvious calculations he inferred, that in a very little time the interest upon all the South-Sea annuities would be reduced from
quoteLast: per cent., without any danger to public credit, or breach of public faith; that then the produce of the sinking fund would amount to fourteen hundred thousand pounds per annum, to be applied only towards redeeming the capital of the several trading companies; he proved that this measure would bring every one of them so much within the power of parliament, that they would be glad to accept of three per cent, interest on any reasonable terms; in which case the sinking-fund would rise to one million six hundred thousand pounds per annum.
title:
The History of England in Three Volumes, Vol.II.
Continued from the Reign of William and Mary to the Death of George II.
author: Smollett, T. (Tobias), 1721-1771

quoteFirst: At this time it was decided to reduce the number of battalions in an infantry brigade from
quoteLast: throughout the British army; as a result many battalions were disbanded and their men sent as drafts to other units. The ⅙th Duke of Wellington’s received about a dozen officers and 300 men from the 5th and 8th battalions of the Duke’s, and were thus brought up to strength.
title: Craven's Part in the Great War
author: Clayton, John T.; Brayshaw, Thomas, 1856-1931 [Contributor]

quoteFirst: Nolan felt cold chills down his spine. He swallowed and asked for the angular relationship of Planet
quoteLast: . The skipper sent someone to find it out. But Nolan had found Planet Four before the answer came.
title: Third Planet
author: Leinster, Murray, 1896-1975

quoteFirst: After two months’ training, when much-needed drafts were absorbed, the Division entered the line in the Givenchy-Festubert area on 15th February, 1918. About this time brigades were reduced from
quoteLast: battalions. The 1/8th and 1/9th Liverpool Regiment and 1/5th Loyal North Lancashire were taken out of the 55th and sent to the 57th. In the beginning of 1918 there was difficulty in keeping second line divisions up to establishment.
title: The Territorial Divisions, 1914-1918
author: Stirling, John

quoteFirst: Frank had netted two runs with that homer, but the eighth opened with the score
quoteLast: in favor of the Clippers, and Craven at bat. He grounded out to Clancy, Merrell fanned, and Runge flied to Lowe. Green again fanned three men, leaving Kess up, and the ninth inning was on.
title: Frank Merriwell's Diamond Foes; Or, Straight Over the Plate
author: Standish, Burt L., 1866-1945

quoteFirst: The Johns Hopkins lacrosse team claimed the championship of the United States, yet in a fast game at Oriole Park, Baltimore, it had been defeated by Harvard, the score being
quoteLast: . One thing that made the pill doubly bitter was the fact that the Hopkins men had been inclined to believe before the game began that they would whitewash the chaps from Cambridge. As if to add to the bitterness, Hopkins made her three goals before Harvard scored at all, which led her players and their admirers to believe the game was safely won.
title: Frank Merriwell's Marriage; Or, Inza's Happiest Day
author: Standish, Burt L., 1866-1945

quoteFirst: "No use!" Barker's voice sang out over the radio. "Look! The blighters are running away.
quoteLast: , and they won't even take a chance. Of all the blasted scared rabbits I ever saw! Can't help it, Dawson! I've got to settle one of the beggars."
title: Dave Dawson, Flight Lieutenant
author: Bowen, Robert Sidney, 1900-1977

title: Amusements in Mathematics

quoteFirst: Mr. WOLCOTT (of Connecticut) was for rating them as
title: The Anti-Slavery Examiner, Part 3 of 4
author: American Anti-Slavery Society

quoteLast: . Mr. Rutledge (of South Carolina) said, for the sake of the object, he would agree to rate slaves as two to one, but he sincerely thought three to one would he a juster proportion. Mr. Holton as four to three.--Mr. Osgood said he did not go beyond four to three.
title: The Anti-Slavery Examiner, Omnibus
